title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 13 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: council yet to fulfil sprinkler promise .

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: weather : more sunshine and showers
text: remaining blustery to end the day with a few heavy showers , these have the potential to be thundery but will move through quickly .
overnight it will be largely dry with clear spells , however a few showers will remain .
min 9c ( 48f ) .
sunshine and showers is the theme again on thursday .
showers may be heavy at times with the risk of thunder .
remaining breezy and feeling cool with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: man in court for neglecting dalmatian puppy
text: the rspca has said a man has been disqualified from keeping animals for 10 years after his pet dalmatian was found in an emaciated state .
alastair watt , from sherwood road , in worksop pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering to the puppy at mansfield magistrates ' court .
the eight-month-old dog , called penny , had been seen by builders who were at watt 's house to carry out some work .
they were so shocked that they contacted the charity .
rspca inspector becky harper said : `` she was so thin and you could see her hip bones , spine and ribs .
she was also very nervous but clearly desperate for food .
`` she weighed 9kg , which is far from what she should have weighed .
it was clearly obvious that she was in a state of neglect . ''
penny has been in rspca foster care since february and has made a full recovery .
she will be available for rehoming soon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash cyclist finds effigy 'hilarious '
text: crash cyclist finds effigy 'hilarious '

documents.title: rise in rough sleepers in the region
text: there has been a significant rise in the number of homeless people in the last seven years in the east midlands .
new figures by the national audit office estimates there were 255 rough sleepers in the region last year compared to 111 in 2010 .
it backs up other recent figures for nottingham which showed a three-fold rise in the last three years to 35 rough sleepers .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : weather and wildlife
text: some wonderful photos from derbyshire this afternoon taken by janice 's patch in wingerworth and anne in brailsford .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: pcc attacks government over police pay rise
text: leicestershire 's police and crime commissioner has described an increase in police pay as `` a cynical deception '' .
yesterday the government announced that police officers would receive a one-off 1 % bonus in addition to a 1 % increase in base salary .
willy bach said : `` her majesty 's government has offered police officers a 1 % bonus for the next calendar year but who is to pay for this extra 1 % ?
`` you might have thought it would be the government putting its money where its mouth is but you would be wrong - her majesty 's government is not putting a penny piece into this bonus .
`` this money is to come from the already absurdly reduced leicestershire police budget . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emile heskey relatives missing in barbuda
text: leicester 's emile heskey has revealed some of his family have been missing since hurricane irma struck the caribbean .
the former footballer , who played for the foxes between 1995 and 2000 , said his parents are safe in antigua but his mother has had no contact with relatives in barbuda for almost a week .
antigua and barbuda prime minister gaston browne said barbuda had been left `` barely habitable '' .

documents.title: views sought on reducing beggar numbers
text: if you often spend time in leicester city centre you may have noticed a large number of street drinkers and people begging for money .
leicester city council said there 's about 50 people who beg on the city 's streets with up to 15 of these begging at any one time in a 24-hour period .
the authority has now launched an eight-week consultation asking for public views on how to tackle the problem .
one potential solution it has come up with is the introduction of a public space protection order ( pspo ) that would mean police and authorised council officers could order people to stop begging .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new life for western park properties
text: a future has finally been found for buildings around the entrance to leicester 's western park .
on one plot of land there is a grade ii listed former `` open-air school '' .
the second plot of land is home to the eco house that opened in 1989 as a flagship environmental project .
parmar properties is hoping to finalise the purchase of both plots of land within the next two weeks .
it plans to demolish the constance jackson centre , better known as the mencap building , and the building housing fosse riders motorcycle association .
on the site they will build 20 new homes .
the former eco house and a part of the school building will be handed over to western ward community enterprises .
it plans to open cafes and community rooms on both sites .
the rest of the school building will be turned into offices .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: anniversary for nottingham fire station
text: happy birthday !
london road fire station is celebrating its first birthday today .
in the 12 months it 's been open crews have attended nearly 2,600 calls .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concern for missing man
text: police have said they are `` concerned '' for the safety of this man who has been reported missing from his home in south wingfield .
the family of 37-year-old richard cano have n't heard from him since the end of august .
they would like to hear from anyone with information on where he is .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'teenagers robbed by moped riders '
text: three teenagers were punched and robbed by two moped riders in derby .
the boys , aged 16 , were cycling along the river derwent near raynesway , when the riders stopped and blocked their path .
one boy had his samsung phone stolen , derbyshire police said .
one rider was wearing a purple derby county away shirt with the name forsyth and the number four on the back and the second moped rider was wearing a grey puffer jacket with an orange zip .
it happened at about 16:00 on 23 august .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: keep your eyes peeled for this apple
text: this amazing apple has been created by a farmer who ploughed the shape in a field .
farmer tim butler created it for sir john starkey and it represents the bramley apple .

in 1910 , mr john r. starkey , then mp for newark , planted a bramley apple orchard and his grandson , sir john starkey , and his daughter , suzannah have kept the fruit-growing tradition alive at their home in norwood park .
all bramley apples are descended from the original tree grown in nearby southwell in 1809 .
it still stands today .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'assault ' during row along clifton tram route
text: officers are investigating a row which went on for seven hours between friday night and saturday morning .
it involved a man and a woman at various locations along the tram route on south church drive in clifton , nottingham .
there were allegations of an assault , nottinghamshire police said .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: teen cellist donates £ 3,000 to school
text: teen cellist donates £ 3,000 to school

documents.title: man jailed over fatal housemate attack
text: man jailed over fatal housemate attack

documents.title: derby 's market hall reopened
text: the market hall in derby has reopened .
it was closed earlier today because of fears the strong winds from storm aileen could cause damage to the glass panes on the roof .
linda aston , chairman of the market hall 's traders association , said a building inspection was done before it reopened .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : tigers consider injury cover for tuilagi
text: leicester tigers are considering using injury dispensation cover to bring in a replacement for centre manu tuilagi .
the england international is expected to be sidelined for more than 12 weeks with a knee injury sustained in the opening premiership game of the season .
tigers are therefore entitled to break the salary cap to make a signing .
we have the potential to use injury dispensation on manu so we will see what is available . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: officer sings while waiting for recovery truck
text: this is certainly one way to pass the time
the officers had seized an abandoned car and were waiting for it to be taken away .
while waiting for the recovery truck for the last car pc collins gave us a tune # xfactorready # voiceofanangel
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid what do you all think ? ?
# xfactor # christmasnumber1
@ twitterid do you fancy a duet ? ?
we have an snt day on 19th oct if you can make it ? ?
# christmasnumberone
coming soon , to a welfare near you !
how long did you have for the recovery truck and how long did it actually seem ?
only thirty minutes to wait felt like a life time
where 's his off switch
we have n't found it yet
all without # pitchbending or in ear monitoring !
# trueprofessional and a bit brave !
do n't give up the day job lol
he should go on x factor
he sounds like a cross between george micheal and johnny cash
x factor
# fantastic # derbyshire has that happiest reason to feel safe .
# policemen # lovetheirjob
the look on the other pc 's face ! !
great stuff .
love it !
you would n't do anything like that
well ?
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man sentenced for killing housemate
text: a 42-year-old man has been sentenced to life in prison for killing his housemate at their home in allenton .
james eames stabbed liam pennick , 43 , several times in march , derbyshire police said .
the court heard how mr pennick was found with bruising to his head , face and chest and evidence of being stamped on while he lay on the ground .
eames was sentenced to life with a minimum term of six years at nottingham crown court today .

eames , who pleaded guilty to manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility , was assessed by psychiatrists who said he was suffering from both organic personality disorder and schizoaffective disorder .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: significant increase in hinckley house prices
text: one part of leicestershire has experienced the second fastest growth in house prices in the country - hinckley .

the multi-million pound redevelopment of the town centre was completed last summer and since then house prices in the area have gone up by almost 15 % according to the office for national statistics .
local estate agents have told the bbc that homes in nearby burbage are particularly desirable .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: john sheridan appeal against notts county
text: john sheridan is having an appeal hearing today against his sacking from the manager 's role at notts county .
mr sheridan was replaced by the magpies chairman alan hardy he bought the club .
he said it was for gross msconduct following a foul mouthed tirade against officials during the two-nil defeat to wycombe in december and not for the club 's poor run of form .
according to the league manager 's association , mr sheridan , who was given a five-game touchline ban for the incident , is arguing that it was n't the only reason why he was fired .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: glassworks and chapels on at-risk list
text: glassworks and chapels on at-risk list

documents.title: football : burton boss hails 'tremendous character ' in norwich draw
text: burton albion manager nigel clough says he needed to see a response from his players after their 5-0 loss to leeds united and `` we got it '' at norwich city .
the brewers held the canaries to a goalless draw at carrow road to earn their first point away from home in 2017-18 and more out of the bottom three in the championship .
burton 's jamie allen went close to goal in the second-half while , at the other end , goalkeeper stephen bywater made two crucial saves to preserve their point .
we needed a response and we got it .
the players showed tremendous character to come to a difficult place like this and up a point .
it 's our first clean sheet , our first away point and gives us something to build on . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: vandalism at allotment site
text: officers are launching regular patrols after fencing at grindleford allotments was damaged .
fruit has also been and thrown around the site , derbyshire police said .
regular patrols will take place and signs will be put up urging people to report any anti-social behaviour .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more unemployment in derbyshire
text: the unemployment rate is down to its lowest level since 1975 - it fell to 4.3 % last month .
the total number of people out of work dropped by 75,000 in the three months to july .
that does n't seem to be reflected in derbyshire where the number of people claiming jobseeker 's allowance rose .
there were more than 100 new people on out-of-work benefits last month .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: false sexual assault claim
text: police investigating reports of a sexual assault in ellistown have found the offence did n't actually take place .
they began investigating the alleged crime last month - it was claimed it happened near a footpath in the beveridge lane and rushby road area .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : full commentary of the second day at the cricket
text: leicestershire resume their first innings on 325 for 7 on day two of the county championship match against worcestershire at new road .
i 'll be bringing you full commentary on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
bradders wednesday morning at new road
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: your comments : great northern railway warehouse
text: you 've been sharing your thoughts on the great northern railway warehouse in derby being named as one of the 10 most endangered buildings in england and wales .
mark reid said : `` it would make some nice apartments , plenty of parking , gardens etc .
could be an amazing space '' .
ann moran said : `` needs preserving before its too late . ''
john powell said : `` should have been sorted years ago instead of being left to rot . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: house prices rise fastest in the east midlands
text: house prices in the east midlands have risen by 7.5 % in the last year according to new figures .
the office for national statistics said the cost of renting a house in the region had gone up by 2.8 % .
julie davies from sneinton said the value of her house had gone up when she was selling it .
she said : `` initially i was testing the water a bit so i had some evaluations and i was quite surprised at what it was priced at .
`` it was definitely higher than what it was a year ago but i made a significant amount from when i first brought it . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: kitten rescued from under floorboards
text: firefighters have rescued a three-month-old kitten from under the floorboards of a house in leicester .
they had to use a heat seeking camera to find the pet that had crawled through a hole left by workmen .
it all ended well with the animal being rescued safe and sound .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hurricane irma : mansfield man relieved to be alive
text: a man from mansfield said he was left without water and slept in his car for days after the island he was on was hit by hurricane irma .
stephen wiffen was staying on st martin in the caribbean for three months selling his time shares but he was eventually evacuated to panama .
stephen , who said he was `` petrified '' and `` still traumatised '' said the roof of his hotel had come off .
`` there was so much relief that we were alive and we survived it but i did n't realise we were in the eye of hurricane irma . ''
stephen claimed americans were helped first and `` three planes had landed on the first day to collect them '' .
`` if you were american they were letting you on the plane but they would n't allow any british or dutch on the planes - it was disgusting .
i felt so let down and ashamed . ''
a spokesperson for the foreign and commonwealth office said evacuation is based on individual need rather than nationality , with the most vulnerable prioritised but more help was on its way .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : leicestershire v worcestershire
text: leicestershire 's batsmen have the upper hand going into the second day of their county championship match against worcestershire at new road .
the foxes will resume on 325 for seven with neil dexter returning to the crease 102 not out .
i 've been having a look at the pitch conditions .
author: Richard Rae
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: council yet to fulfil sprinkler promise
text: an investigation by bbc breakfast has found that just 2 % of council owned high rise blocks in england are fully fitted with sprinkler systems .
a freedom of information request also showed that 68 % of the blocks had only one staircase .

following the fire at grenfell tower in london , leicester city council promised to install sprinkler systems in all six of its high-rise tower blocks but three months on no work has yet been carried out .
one man who lives in a council run tower block in leicester told the bbc `` i 'm worried about my safety '' and said it would be `` better '' if they did have sprinklers fitted .
leicester city council has said they 're appointing a specialist to ensure that the right sprinkler system is designed for each tower block .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clumber park to open after storm aileen
text: clumber park will be open as normal today .
a statement was issued yesterday about a planned closure because of storm aileen , which hit parts of the country last night .
update on wind speeds : the park will be open as normal today .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tributes paid to nottingham graduate who died in the alps
text: the mother of a university graduate who died while hiking in the italian alps has paid tribute to her son .
keaton emery , 23 , who was a former university of nottingham student , was found by rescue teams at the bottom of a 60ft crag on the legnoncino mountain on sunday .
his mother denise emery said : `` people only had to meet him for a few hours and they would remember him forever .
`` he loved meeting new people , experiencing how they live and discovering their stories .
he was a curious person who wanted to enjoy life and have a laugh . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former railway warehouse at 'tipping point of salvation '
text: the old great northern railway warehouse in derby has been named on a list of the top 10 endangered buildings in england and wales .
the list is compiled annually by the national architecture charity the victorian society .
this grade ii railway warehouse has been left derelict for almost 50 years .
it was built in 1877 by kirk and randall as part of the great northern railway at friargate station .
planning permission was granted for the site to be redeveloped into a shopping and accommodation complex in 2011 but these plans have stalled .
the victorian society said the building is frequently targeted by arsonists and is at the `` tipping point of salvation '' with `` emergency action '' needed to secure its future .
other buildings on the list include chance 's glassworks in the west midlands and the buckley 's brewery maltings in wales .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trams stopped because of house fire
text: tram services through clifton were briefly suspended this morning because of a house fire .
there was no service between south church drive and clifton south between 06:15 and 07:00 .
net said nottinghamshire fire and rescue service needed to access a pump on south church drive .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottinghamshire quilt gifted to america
text: a quilt showcasing 400 years of nottinghamshire 's history has been gifted to america .
it was created by the county branch of the quilters ' guild as part of bbc radio nottingham 's campaign to mark the region 's pilgrim fathers ' place in history .
here 's the moment it was revealed to the mayflower descendants association
at the centre of the patchwork quilt is a panel honoring william brewster , from scrooby , who sailed on the mayflower in 1620 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands roads
text: nottinghamshire
derbyshire
leicestershire
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a yellow warning for wind remains in place but we can expect clearer weather later on .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
